intro: Schizomeria gorumensis, commonly known as the Gorumense schizomeria, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Schizomeria gorumensis is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
